item.title: France Considering Banning Polymarket: The Big Whale
item.description:
French regulator Autorite Nationale des Jeux (better known as the National Gambling Authority) is reportedly considering banning Polymarket in the European country, French news outlet The Big Whale reported Wednesday, November 6. The news follows attention-grabbing bets from a French national related to the 2024 U.S. presidential election on Polymarket, sparking market manipulation concerns.

The post France Considering Banning Polymarket: The Big Whale appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: CISA Alerts to Active Exploitation of Critical Palo Alto Networks Vulnerability
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) on Thursday added a now-patched critical security flaw impacting Palo Alto Networks Expedition to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, citing evidence of active exploitation.
The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-5910 (CVSS score: 9.3), concerns a case of missing authentication in the Expedition migration tool that

item.title: Google Warns of Actively Exploited CVE-2024-43093 Vulnerability in Android System
item.description:
Google has warned that a security flaw impacting its Android operating system has come under active exploitation in the wild.
The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-43093, has been described as a privilege escalation flaw in the Android Framework component that could result in unauthorized access to "Android/data," "Android/obb," and "Android/sandbox" directories, and their respective
